elements.title: 150-year-old wooden models (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 150-year-old wooden models of the Temple Mount (example pictured) are important to archaeology, as their creator was the last European ever permitted to survey its foundations?

elements.title: Sarah Jane Baker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Sarah Jane Baker was released after 30 years, she was the United Kingdom's longest serving transgender prisoner?

elements.title: Massachusetts gave the United States (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Massachusetts gave the United States its first openly LGBT state legislator to be elected, as well as the first out congressperson and state attorney general?

elements.title: rare silver coins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Royal Mint reportedly shipped rare silver coins to New Zealand in unsecured bags, claiming they had not been advised to take extra precaution?

elements.title: Senpai, This Can't Be Love! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Toshiki Seto was cast in the television adaptation of Senpai, This Can't Be Love! because, according to the creator, he could express emotion through his stare?

elements.title: King v Bourne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the judge in the 1938 King v Bourne trial stated that performing an abortion might prevent a "physical or mental wreck"?

elements.title: 2023 MLS Cup Playoffs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2023 MLS Cup Playoffs feature 62 percent of the league's teams?

elements.title: John Snow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the John Snow pub is named for a shy British epidemiologist who did not drink?
